TITLE: Firmware Engineer
BODY:
We at Avestec are pioneering the future of aerial robotics to provide a quicker and safer alternative for industrial inspection. We are searching for a Firmware Developer to help us with the development of our robotic inspection products. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing firmware to integrate new devices onto our aerial robots and ensure the complete system functions as intended.
Required Qualifications:
- Pursuing or completed a degree in related Engineering
- Experience developing within a Linux environment using the command-line
- Experience using version control (e.g. Git, Bitbucket)
- Highly proficient in C programming
- Understanding of MCU peripherals (e.g. timers, I2C, UART, SPI)
- Understanding of RTOS concepts (e.g. task scheduling, inter-task communication)
- Experience working with embedded-Linux devices (e.g. Raspberry Pi, Jetson Nano)
- Experience working with wireless communication modules (e.g. WiFi, sub-GHz)
- Able to use a multimeter and oscilloscope for debugging
- Writing documentation
- Able to work full-time
Desirable Skills and Experience:
- Experience with STM32 ARM Cortex-M microcontroller
- Familiar with robotic control, motor control, PID and algorithm development
- Familiar with Python programming
Job Type: Full-time
Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Burnaby, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

 Please advise your current residence city AND status in Canada (PR/Citizen/Work Permit)

Work Location: One location

TITLE: Firmware Engineer
BODY:
About NETINT Technologies Inc.
 
  NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  
   Develop video firmware on SOC 
  Develop drivers on Linux embedded platform 
  Debug firmware and software issues 
  Conduct unit test and integration test 
  Writing relevant documentation
 
  
  
  Education & Experience requirements
  
  
  
  MS or BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering/Science 
  Proficient in structured firmware/software programming (C/C++) 
  Understand of low-level hardware architecture, and be familiar with at least one CPU/MCU architecture (ARM, Xtensa, RISC-v, etc.) 
  Experience in video decode/encode 
  With enthusiasm on software development, strong learning capability and communication skills
 
  
  
  Desirable Skills/ Experiences
  
  
  
  Experience in Windows and Linux driver will be a plus
 
  
  
  We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
  Acknowledgment and Agreement
 
  NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

TITLE: Senior /Lead Control Engineer
BODY:
Are you excited to lead the innovation of AI and automation in industrial robotics? If the answer is yes, we have an opportunity for you.
Our never-before-seen welding cobots require customization and R&D. We are looking for a Senior /Lead Control Engineer to join our growing team and support the development of our cobots.
Responsibilities

 Developing control system designs following systems engineering methodologies
 PLC programming and Electrical design
 Design/programming of Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)
 Troubleshooting of electrical, PLC, and HMI systems
 Interfacing with real-time database applications to manage critical production information
 Preparing functional specifications
 Estimating, planning and executing projects
 Adhering to all health and safety rules and procedures
 Performing other duties as assigned by management

Qualifications and Experience

 Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Electrical/Controls/Software Engineering
 Competent skills in C/C++ and/or Python programming in Linux
 Proven skills in developing motion control embedded software in multithreaded, real-time environments
 Familiarity with ROS/ROS2
 Experience with 6 DoF robotics
 Experience with PLC programming (ie. ladder logic, structured text, state diagram)
 Expertise with safety PLCs, safety standards, and risk assessment
 Strong knowledge of control theory, feedback control, data filtering, and different control strategies such as PID, and MPC
 Experience with different communication protocols such as EtherCAT, Ethernet/IP, Modbus TCP, CANopen, Devicenet, UDP, etc
 Applicants must complete an online coding assessment prior to meeting the screener

About Novarc Technologies:
Novarc Technologies is a Vancouver-based full-stack robotics and AI company specializing in the design and commercialization of cobots and AI systems for robotic welding applications. Novarc’s flagship product Spool Welding Robot (SWR) is the world’s first welding cobot and SWR has already won multiple industry awards, been featured in top publications, and generated significant revenue).
Our diverse team consists of engineers, developers, technicians, welders, scientists who are designing and building the welding industry’s most advanced automation solutions with the passion of helping our customers win.
Why Novarc:

 Growing Opportunities - We are in the process of maturing into a fast-growing medium-sized business.
 Great place to be - We have created a fun, adventurous, and open-minded environment where our teams are encouraged to bond and expose a little weirdness.
 Best People - Our team is made up of talented, intelligent, and hardworking people.
 Lots of Opportunities - We are constantly looking for stand-out talent internally to move into leadership positions.

We are excited to invite you to join our growing team for this amazing journey!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Company events
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Employee assistance program
 Extended health care
 Flexible schedule

 Paid time off

TITLE: Intermediate Systems Engineer – Flight Software
Senior Software Engineer - VIDEO - Greater Vancouver area Candidate
BODY:
At WISI, we have spent almost 100 years focused on implementing the most innovative and reliable technology solutions.
  
  We are looking for a local Senior Software Engineers to join us as we scale up our Engineering team here at WISI, delivering carrier-grade video transcoder products to cable/video operators.
  
  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and have some awesome perks in our beautiful office space. The company is located in Pitt Meadows, BC a suburb of Metro Vancouver. We are in a gorgeous location near walking and biking trails, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. 
  We are proud to have been certified as a Great Place To Work after a thorough and independent analysis conducted by the Great Place To Work Institute Canada for the 5th consecutive year.
  
  
  The Role: 
  You will join our growing engineering team as a Senior Software Engineer to design and build high-performance video delivery solutions. We are a small passionate team focused on delivering carrier grade software to our customers in an agile fashion.
  
  You are passionate about technology and have worked previously in the video processing industry. You have experience with a variety of programming languages and technologies and aren’t afraid to try a new one. Your passion for software development keeps you learning and adopting new techniques and trends to improve how you work, not just the code you write.
   You will: 
  
  Collaborate with other software developers to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web and embedded applications. 
  Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code.  
  Design and implement tools and processes to rapidly iterate and continuously release software. 
  Mentor and support the growth and development of other team members by sharing your experiences and best practices. 
  Produce well-organized, optimized, and documented source code. 
  Develop repeatable scientific test methods and tools for performance and load testing of company products and prototypes and quality assurance initiatives. 
  Analyze test results to identify issues and opportunities and characterize hardware and software performance to aid in business planning, new product discovery and product improvement.
 
  
  
  Required skills: 
  
  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related discipline  
  5+ years of professional experience in software development 
  Experience with Gstreamer Media Framework 
  Working knowledge of various conditional access/video/audio codec and streaming protocols including MPEG-2-TS, AVC, HEVC, HLS, MPEG-DASH, Dolby Digital 
  Working knowledge of various video broadcast and transmission standards (ATSC, DVB , NTSC, PAL) 
  Use the technology stack that includes but not limited to: C/C++, Golang, JavaScript, Shell Scripts, Git, Linux, Docker 
  Knowledge of OOP design and patterns.  
  Knowledge of SQL and noSQL databases, including postgres, redis, influxdb, mysql 
  Understanding of software development best practices and experience with unit testing, using version control systems (Git), and continuous integration. 
  Experience with Agile methodologies 
  Passion for quality and writing clean, solid, readable code that scales and performs well
 
  
  
  Bonus Skills: 
  
  Experience with various embedded processor architectures 
  Experience in web technologies utilizing microservices and REST
 
  
  
  What’s in it for you: 
  
  A chance to work on cutting edge technology, with global customers, in a hot industry. 
  Learning is one of our core values so there are many opportunities for career development through lunch & learns, training, courses etc. 
  We offer competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision coverage, and an Employee and Family Assistance Program to support the wellbeing of you and your family. 
  Additional health and wellness support through a health & wellness spending account to put your dollars where you need it most. 
  Flexible, hybrid work environment 
  Birthday Day off - after all this is YOUR day. 
  RRSP matching program - we invest in your future. 
  Paid Volunteer Hours. 
  Be a part of a team of incredibly talented, driven, fun and supportive teammates. 
  Contribute to WISI’s award-winning Culture. We’re a Certified Great Place To Work and on the 2021 list of Best Workplace in Canada. 
  There's more but we will tell you more when we meet you!
 
  
  Must be eligible to work in Canada
 
  We are an equal opportunity employer and a very diverse company! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, age, language or disability status.

TITLE: Senior Firmware/ Software Engineer
BODY:
About NETINT Technologies Inc.
 
  NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
 
  Job Scope
 
  NETINT provides hardware smart video transcoding solutions for cloud users. Its new generation chip has world-leading video encoding quality, throughput, with ultra-low latency. With its embedded AI inference capability, the new generation chip allows users to perform video analytics, video enhancement, and other smart videos/audios functionalities. We are looking for a Firmware/Software Engineer to help us create artificial intelligence products.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  
   Design and implement machine learning systems based on the SOC platform 
  Analyzing and enhancing efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources 
  Interface with hardware design and development 
  Performance optimization and system fine-tuning 
  Maintain and extend existing machine learning libraries and frameworks 
  Keep abreast of developments in the field
 
  
  
  Qualifications
 
  
   Deep knowledge of the embedded system, firmware (3+ years) 
  Ability to write robust code in C/C++, Python 
  Good communication skills 
  Ability to work in a team 
  Good analytical and problem-solving skills 
  Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture 
  BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus 
  Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and libraries is a plus 
  Previous experience with hardware encoder/decoder is a plus 
  Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role is a plus 
  Previous experience with image/audio processing is a plus 
  Previous experience with NPU (deep learning inference engine) is a plus
 
   
 We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
  Acknowledgment and Agreement
 
  NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

TITLE: Full Stack Developer - Android/iOS Application and Bluetooth - Vodasafe
BODY:
VodaSafe saves lives. We build innovative technology for first responders and search and rescue personnel. Our first product, AquaEye®, is a hand-held sonar device for water rescue that launched in 2019. We are seeking a bright and highly motivated individual to join our team, bring new ideas to product design and aid new customers in using AquaEye to help their teams stay safe and respond to emergency situations faster.  
  We are seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our team on a contract basis and help us build a cross-platform Android and iOS application with a back end. The application will connect to a handheld device using Bluetooth technology to program the device and download data from the device, which will be used to display information to users. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design, development, and deployment of the application and will be expected to work collaboratively with our team to deliver a high-quality product.
   Responsibilities: 
  
   Develop a cross-platform Android and iOS application with a back-end that connects to a handheld device using Bluetooth technology 
  
  
   Work closely with our team to understand the product requirements and user needs 
   Develop a user-friendly interface for the application 
   Develop the back-end system to manage the data and integrate with the front-end 
   Ensure that the application is scalable, reliable, and secure 
   Troubleshoot and debug any issues that arise during the development process 
  
  
   Optimize the application for performance and speed 
   Develop and maintain documentation for the application 
   Provide suggestions for improvements to the application. 
  
  Requirements
   Requirements:
  
    Applicants of all levels are welcome, including senior leads, engineers, and graduate candidates
  
  
    At least 3 years of experience in developing cross-platform Android and iOS applications with a back-end that can connect to a physical device 
   Hands-on experience with integration of HW/SW systems using Bluetooth Low Energy 
   Strong knowledge of front-end development tools and frameworks, such as React Native and Flutter 
   Experience with back-end development tools and frameworks, such as Node.js 
   Experience with database technologies such as MySQL, MongoDB, and Firebase 
  
  
   Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform 
   Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously 
   Experience with Agile development methodologies is a plus 
  
  Nice to have experience with:
  
    Experience with any of the following: User interface design, IoT solutions, Embedded systems, C/C++, Microcontrollers
  
  
    Familiarity with DevOps or equivalent 
  
  Benefits
   This is a contract opportunity with the possibility of full time.

TITLE: Intermediate System Engineer
BODY:
About NETINT Technologies Inc.
 
  NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
 
  About this Position
 
  This is a Full-time, Regular employment opportunity. NETINT offers competitive salaries, benefits and endless learning and development opportunities.
 
  This is a flexible position and has the option of working in either Burnaby or Markham office.
 
  Job Scope
 
  As a System Engineer, you are responsible for the functionality and quality of the ASIC design at the system level. You are detail oriented in designing and executing stress tests, and good at systematically identifying and reproducing hardware and firmware issues. You will be working closely with ASIC designer and embedded FW engineer to develop solutions and workarounds. Responsibilities for this position include designing/ implementing/ executing stress tests at subsystem and system levels, functional modules, and all data flows of Storage and Video SoCs.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  
   Hands on debug capability using lab equipment and debugger tools 
  Bring up of embedded CPU/GPU cores, subsystem blocks and system level integration on prototype boards 
  Develop embedded firmware for system level stress tests 
  Develop automation test platform and test scripts 
  Work with hardware and firmware teams on identifying and resolving issues, and come up with workaround solutions 
  Work on prototyping platform development and verification of current and future SoCs
 
  
  
  Qualifications
 
  
   MS or BS in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent 
  Minimum 2 years of experiences in system validation or ASIC/FPGA IP/VIP integration and design 
  Ability to understand hardware technical reference manual 
  Experience with embedded FW in C/C++ and assembly 
  Experience with CPU architectures, high speed I/Os and on-chip interconnects 
  Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, TCL, Perl 
  Strong ability to analyze complex HW issues and find resolutions
 
  
  
  Highly Desirable Skills
 
  
   Experience of working on video products is an asset 
  Experience in PCB design, layout, and board bring up is an asset 
  Knowledge of silicon testing/qualification procedure/methodology for production is an asset
 
  
  
  We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
  Acknowledgment and Agreement
 
  NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

TITLE: Senior Technical Program Manager, Availability
BODY:
Company Description
  Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.
  Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.
  There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.
 
 

 Job Description
  We’re hiring for a Senior Technical Program Manager - Reliability for the Reliability and Incident Management TPM team in Foundational Engineering. The Reliability and Incident Management Team is focused on driving our longer term Reliability and Incident Management roadmap across Square and enabling more predictable outcomes for our engineers and sellers under fire through processes, tooling and frameworks.
  We’re looking for a TPM to coordinate and drive large-scale Site Reliability and Disaster Recovery initiatives at Square. You will help to report on organizational-level reliability and disaster recovery trends. You will deliver projects that build resilience into Square’s critical business systems and ensure service and data availability for our sellers. You will use your program leadership skills and technical expertise in DevOps (site reliability, disaster recovery and tooling automation) to deliver successful project outcomes.
  Note this role will report into our TPM Lead for Reliability and Incident Management and partner closely with our Cloud Platform Engineering organization within Foundational Engineering.
  What You Will Be Doing:
 
   Create Square-wide Disaster Recovery metrics and guide adoption of Disaster Recovery program
   Lead planning, execution and monitoring of large scale initiatives related to Site Reliability and Disaster Recovery and coordinate cross-functional dependencies
   Work with teams to clarify objectives, KPIs and success criteria and communicate blockers, risks and outcomes to management
   Take a data-driven approach to program management, building tools and leveraging data to drive stakeholder buy-in
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  Must have:
 
   Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Information Systems and/or equivalent work experience in related technical field
   5+ years of technical program management experience in agile software development environment with a proven track record leading large, complex technology projects and managing risks
   Fluency in Agile project management methodologies (such as Kanban, Scrum, or SAFe); having an active project management certification (PMP, CSM, etc) is a strong plus
   Solid understanding of SDLC and familiarity with software architecture and design
   Firm grasp of traditional SRE and DevOps concepts
   Prior experience with a public cloud such as AWS, GCP, etc.
   Experience with data manipulation and analysis
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills
   Strong collaboration skills; comfortable working with leadership and explaining technical subject matter to non-technical business partners
 
  Nice to have:
 
   Experience and comfort working with remote, distributed project teams
   Have partnered with stakeholders on disaster or business continuity related governance
   Prior experience as a software engineer, developer or SRE is a huge plus
   Experience with quality assurance, quality engineering or test engineering
   Experience with project management and work productivity tools such as Jira, Google Suite, SmartSheets
   Exposure to observability tools such as SignalFx, Datadog, Sentry and PagerDuty
 
  Additional Information
 
  We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace.
  Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.
  Learn more about our efforts to promote inclusion and diversity at block.xyz/inclusion
  Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
  Perks
  We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:
 
   Healthcare coverage
   Retirement Plans
   Employee Stock Purchase Program
   Wellness perks
   Paid parental leave
   Paid time off
   Learning and Development resources
 
  Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.
